image.altText: A woman smiles.

props.synopsis: A man accused of attacking two women – killing one and seriously injuring another – was discharged from the Royal Adelaide Hospital on Monday. He appeared in court and has been remanded in custody.

title.children: Friends mourn mum who'd started 'dream job' as details emerge of suspect's release from hospital before 'random' stabbing

image.altText: Composite image of an accused and a victim.

props.synopsis: Dhirren Randhawa, who is accused of causing the death of Charlie Stevens last month during Schoolies celebrations has asked a magistrate to vary his bail conditions – so he can have contact with his friend, who is a case witness.

title.children: Teen accused of killing SA Police Commissioner's son granted permission to contact witness friend

image.altText: The top of a police car with the word 'Police' on it. Some city buildings are in the background

props.synopsis: Jordan Lloyd Koch — who was found guilty earlier this year of unlawful sexual intercourse and two counts of indecent assault — has had his conviction overturned in the South Australian Court of Appeal.

title.children: SA police officer jailed for sexually assaulting teenager has conviction overturned

image.altText: An aerial image of a house on fire and partially collapsed in a semi-rural area.

props.synopsis: Homes are razed and two men hurt as a bushfire that earlier tore through Parkerville, Stoneville and Hovea, forcing residents to flee, is contained by firefighters. Follow live.

title.children: Two homes lost in Parkerville amid new fire emergencies in Eaton, Toodyay

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside court.

props.synopsis: Network Ten's lawyers are summing up the broadcaster's defence before Bruce Lehrmann's legal team gives its closing arguments tomorrow.

title.children: 'Fundamentally dishonest man': Network Ten lawyers make closing arguments in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case

image.altText: A man has short grey hair, he wears a red top with a black vest. He looks over veranda to green backyard with a mound of dirt

props.synopsis: It's been 12 months since the River Murray flood event, which saw countless homes and properties inundated with water. For Peter Smith, the levy which surrounds his house is a daily reminder of how lucky he was.

title.children: Every morning, Peter looks at the big pile of dirt sitting in front of his house with a feeling of gratitude

image.altText: Line of people in queue at Virgin Australia check-in at Brisbane Airport

props.synopsis: Millions of Australians are braving packed airports around the country this holiday period, but some may be frustrated by delays and cancellations. See how each airline performs.

title.children: Flying this Christmas? See which airline has the most cancelled flights

image.altText: A composite of Ernest Head, Crispin Dye and John Russell and police tape in the background

props.synopsis: For 18 months, the inquiry investigated the suspicious deaths or unsolved murders — potentially motivated by gay hate bias — of LGBTIQ people between 1970 and 2010.

title.children: Unsolved murders inquiry in NSW calls for fresh inquests into deaths of several men

image.altText: A group of young men with shaved heads standing around a young man in a chair in a hospital room

props.synopsis: Broken Hill residents from as young as 16 and as old as 71 shave their heads in support of a friend and family member who was diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of leukaemia.

title.children: 'True show of mateship' as family, friends rally for promising young footballer diagnosed with cancer

image.altText: Smoke coming from behind the eaton medical centre.

props.synopsis: A bushfire crisis in Perth's hills eases, but blazes burning in Toodyay and Eaton flare up again to put homes under threat.

title.children: 'Everything is gone': Perth hills fire crisis eases after homes lost in Parkerville, but Toodyay and Eaton fires flare up

image.altText: image of convicted terrorist Abdul Benbrika

props.synopsis: Benbrika was released from detention this week after spending nearly two decades behind bars over plots to commit terror attacks at high-profile events in Australia.

title.children: Convicted terrorist Abdul Nacer Benbrika banned for life from MCG and Crown Casino

image.altText: Woman with grey hair wearing brown jacket and shirt stands amid flowers with greenery in background

props.synopsis: In a tiny country hamlet, where locals fight plans to transform their town into a food-tourism destination, who gets to decide what the future of the place looks like?

title.children: Country town backlash over developer plans to become foodie destination

image.altText: a young child wearing headphones on a chinook helicopter

props.synopsis: All vulnerable people have been evacuated from Kowanyama in Cape York, while Energy Minister Mick de Brenni promises Queensland's far northern communities the lights will be back on for Christmas.

title.children: Evacuation of Wujal Wujal continues, minister promises Far North Queensland lights back on for Christmas

image.altText: A close-up of solar panels on top of a house

props.synopsis: Renewable energy provides the cheapest source of new energy for Australia, a new draft report from the CSIRO and energy market operator has found.

title.children: Nuclear energy is more expensive than renewables, CSIRO report finds

image.altText: An older man in a black coat and a lot of orange bronzer speaks outside behind a lectern.

props.synopsis: The push to bar Mr Trump from the presidential race under the US constitution's insurrection clause is gathering steam and appears to be headed straight to the Supreme Court.

title.children: Donald Trump has been barred from appearing on Colorado's Republican primary ballot. What happens now?

image.altText: Two women sit on a beach taking photos on their phone of a sunrising over the water at Bondi Beach

props.synopsis: This week, inhabitants of the Southern Hemisphere will experience their longest stretch of daylight hours over a 24-hour period, as the summer solstice approaches once again.

title.children: Tomorrow will be Australia's longest day of the year. Here's the science behind it

image.altText: A woman in a blue dress and red lipstick smiles as she kneels at a pink retro style oven

props.synopsis: While tradwives emerge across the political spectrum, a small subculture use their platforms to promote the dark ideas of the far-right — including in Australia, write Kristy Campion and Kiriloi M Ingram.

title.children: There is a seductive simplicity to the tradwife trend. But their far-right beliefs can be dangerous

image.altText: Headshot of missing woman Tina Greer smiling at camera.

props.synopsis: More than a decade after Tina Greer's disappearance, a coroner rules she was murdered "most likely violently" by her then boyfriend Leslie "Grumpy" Sharman, who died in 2018.

title.children: Missing Gold Coast woman most likely murdered by now-dead bikie boyfriend, coroner rules

image.altText: Eva Lawler and Chansey Paech smile during a press conference.

props.synopsis: The new leader enters the role following the resignation of Natasha Fyles and eight months out from the next territory election, with Labor aiming to secure a third term.

title.children: Eva Lawler sworn in as NT chief minister as she unveils her new-look cabinet

props.synopsis: The maps and accompanying instructions distributed by Israel to help warn Gaza residents of combat areas have been unclear and contradictory, an ABC analysis shows.

title.children: 'Please reply': Israel's warning system leaves Gaza residents confused

props.synopsis: Nearly 2 million people – approximately 85 per cent of Gaza's population – have been forced to leave their homes since the start of the Israel-Gaza War. Israel has been warning civilians to avoid combat areas, but people are running out of places to go.

title.children: Israel-Gaza war: Where can the people of Gaza go?

image.altText: ANZ CEO Shayne Elliott

props.synopsis: ANZ boss Shayne Elliott says mortgage hardship cases are emerging but the bank still plans to grow its home loan business. The Australian share market finished the day lower.

title.children: As it happend: ANZ boss warns of mortgage hardship, ASX closes lower

image.altText: Naval personnel stand on the ship HMAS Toowoomba, looking out to sea during a deployment in Japan

props.synopsis: Australia will not send a warship to the Red Sea as part of international efforts to safeguard cargo from attacks by Iranian-backed Houthi rebels.

title.children: Australia declines US request for Red Sea warship, sending personnel instead

image.altText: A medium shot of a middle-aged Black man outside on a footpath raising both arms in the air and smiling.

props.synopsis: Glynn Simmons, 71, becomes the longest-serving US inmate to be declared innocent of a crime.

title.children: US man declared innocent of murder after almost 50 years in prison

image.altText: A close-up of lava flying out of the mouth of an active volcano.

props.synopsis: Scientists say the eruption was expected after thousands of small earthquakes, but it could continue for some time.

title.children: Iceland's volcano eruption means some 'won't be home for Christmas'. Here's what we know

image.altText: Smoke rises from a building with a mosque in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The leader of Hamas pays his first visit to Egypt in more than a month, a rare personal intervention in diplomacy amid talks on a new ceasefire to let aid reach Gaza and free more hostages.

title.children: Hamas leader visits Egypt for ceasefire talks as Israel says major underground command centre uncovered

image.altText: Woman in a hi-vis pink work uniform and hard hat sitting in a vehicle.

props.synopsis: When Justin Coburn first came to Narrandera in search of a workforce to build a solar farm, he was met with scepticism and questions. Soon a unique partnership formed and the project brought an overwhelming sense of pride for the 30 First Nations men and women who worked on it.

title.children: A workforce was waiting. But they were 'invisible' until one company took a chance

image.altText: A plastic inflatable castle

props.synopsis: An inflatable jumping castle that claimed the lives of six Tasmanian primary school children after becoming airborne in 2021 was only secured at half its anchor points, a court document alleges.

title.children: How did a jumping castle lift off and kill six children? Court document reveals allegations against operator

image.altText: Protesters are pictured with red flags

props.synopsis: Thousands take to the streets of Buenos Aires to protest against the government's economic shock measures, in the first real test for Argentina's new president, Javier Milei.

title.children: Protesters take to the street in Argentina in response to new president's plan

image.altText: Jadd William Brooker

props.synopsis: Adelaide paedophile Jadd William Brooker, who committed some of "the worst and most degrading offending" seen by investigating police, has been handed a 36-year sentence. WARNING: This story contains distressing details.

title.children: 'Vile' Adelaide paedophile sentenced to 36 years in jail for child sex offending

image.altText: a flooded playground

props.synopsis: It's not just crocs lurking in floodwaters, small bacteria could provide one big headache in north Queensland. But there are ways to stay safe.

title.children: Mud, water, and mosquitoes pose triple threat after record floods in Queensland

image.altText: A composite image of a man looking at the camera, and a large fire

props.synopsis: Jordan Shanks-Markovina, 34, better known as his online moniker Friendlyjordies, was away when his home was set alight in November last year.

title.children: Alameddine crime network associate charged over firebombing of Friendlyjordies's Bondi home

image.altText: A girl with long red hair stands in a snowy field

props.synopsis: The boy and girl, who were 15 at the time of the murder, spent months plotting to kill someone before the murder of Brianna Ghey in north-western England, a court hears.

title.children: UK teens found guilty of 'frenzied and ferocious' killing of transgender girl

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge tells Mahmut Cigercioglu that family violence cannot be tolerated as she sentences him to 15 years' jail over the stabbing attack of his wife.

title.children: Judge sentences man to 15 years in prison for stabbing wife and driving off with their baby in Shepparton

image.altText: Francis and a US Navy officer with his face blurred smile for a photo.

props.synopsis: Leonard Francis, who has pleaded guilty to bribing US Navy officials and defence contractors, is returned to America after escaping to Venezuela last year.

title.children: 'Fat Leonard,' a fugitive now returning to the US, was behind one of the military's biggest scandals
